description:
**Tool Overview**:

This resource provides details on the Windows Recovery Environment update that addresses specific issues related to error messages encountered during installations.

**Details**:

The update mentioned in the KB article aims to correct problems with the error code handling routine in Windows 10 versions 21H2 and 22H2, particularly when the system is low on disk space. When this issue occurs, users may see an incorrect error message, such as *0x80070643 - error_install_failure*, instead of more informative prompts. The update enhances the clarity and context of error messages, allowing for better troubleshooting and resolution processes.

**Usage**:

Administrators are encouraged to apply this update to ensure that potential installation errors related to insufficient disk space are reported accurately, improving the efficiency of system maintenance and user support.

For detailed steps on applying this update, consult the Microsoft support page linked below.
